definition: to adopt/to give for adoption (usually to a childless relative)
(experienced action marker)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards

sentences.english: The airline guaranteed that proper adoption procedures would be followed .
sentences.chinese: 航空公司保證按照正當的過繼程序辦事。

sentences.english: Balzac failures never faltered his drive to continue to write novels and novelettes .
sentences.chinese: 他屢屢失敗，但從未放棄過繼續寫小說的念頭。

sentences.english: Adoptive cellular immunotherapy is one of the important approaches.
sentences.chinese: 過繼性回輸免疫效應細胞是其中的重要方法之一。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the therapeutic effect of the new method-adoptive cell immunotherapy on ovarian carcinoma.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討卵巢癌過繼細胞免疫治療新方法。

sentences.english: I haven't got a son, so I adopted one from my eldest brother.
sentences.chinese: 我沒兒子，就從大哥家過繼了一個嗣子。

sentences.english: Upon his decease all his properties passed to his wife.
sentences.chinese: 由於他的死亡，他所有的財產都過繼給了他妻子。

definition: to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
paternal uncle
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
to resign a government post
to settle a marriage/betrothal
to leave office
Laiyang county level city in Yantai 煙台|烟台, Shandong
leadership authority
taboo name (e.g. of emperor)
to open up land (for agriculture)
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
Guoxing or Kuohsing township in Nantou county 南投縣|南投县[Nan2 tou2 xian4], central Taiwan
